headline: Puerto Rico Outage Leaves More Than 1.2 Million Without Power on New Year’s Eve
summary: An islandwide outage left most of Puerto Rico without power on New Year’s Eve, with a full fix 24 to 48 hours away.  Luma Energy, a Canadian-American consortium that took charge of the Caribbean island’s electric grid in 2021, said the outage began at 5:30 a.m. As of noon on the island, more than 1.2 million customers, or 83% of them, were without power.  On social media, Luma said the cause of the outage was under investigation, and preliminary findings suggested a fault with an underground line.
